page.title: 18GUNSTONE MILL DAIRY FARM
page.content: On Tuesday the 16th July we went to Gunstone Mill,it is about 6 kilometres away from school.When we got there we met Mr Bickley who owns the farm.First we looked at Gunstone bridge which is built over the River Yeo.In the winter the river sometimes floods and there are some marsh areas .Then we went into see the old mill and now Mr Bickley keeps all of his hay ready for the winter, it is dry and sheltered in there.One room is where cows are kept in winter (20 in all). We looked down and we saw the place where water came through to work the mill.Then Mr Bickley came he showed us inside the mill and where he blocked up the hole in the wall.There used to be two big water wheels in the barn because the mill was powerd by water.The mill was mainly for grinding barley.
